jobDescription: CAT - Special Reserve Force Team Copart's CAT - Special Reserve Force Team is a vital component of our operation and is looked to for support during catastrophes, integrations, and other special projects; its members are considered ambassadors of Copart as they travel from yard to yard. Being a part of the Special Reserve Force Team is about dropping everything, sometimes at a moment's notice. It means being away from home, working long grueling hours, being away from family and, due to availability, sometimes living in cramped conditions. However, Copart Special Reserve Force is also about helping your fellow Copart yard by helping to lift that yard back on its feet after facing a natural disaster or welcoming and training new divisions to the Copart family. It's about accomplishing so much each day. It's about camaraderie among your peers, seeing new yards, learning from those yards and applying what you've seen, and being able to share your knowledge with the staff at your home yard. Work at a Copart location that has just experienced a devastating event, work onsite at a customer's location for a special project, or arrive at a newly acquired business to integrate it with Copart Learn more about Copart and build valuable friendships Sign up for a 12-month commitment (January through December) Deploy on assignment for 3 or more weeks at a time Have no limit to the number of deployments or projects Agree to deploy to any given assignment and/or location at a moment's notice (typically 24 to 48 hours' notice is given) Work 10 to 12 hour days, 7 days a week, depending on the help needed Gain much experience during the 12-month period Required Skills & Experience Have a solid understanding of Copart office and yard operations Have a recent CIS rating of Meets Expectations or higher Have a valid driver's license Have a credit card Be able to commit to a minimum of 3 weeks' consecutive duty Be able to travel on short notice Be able to work extended work days/weeks, possibly up to 12 hours per day in adverse conditions Tolerate living and working in primitive or cramped quarters during assignments Exhibit a high level of professionalism, dependability, and clear communication skills Remain relaxed and calm in stressful situations Be able to work independently or in a team environment Enjoy learning new areas of our business Take pride in helping others Consider yourself "a bid above the rest" Have at least 12 months' work experience with Copart Must be a full time employee For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Take charge of your sales career with Copart Dealer Services. Copart is seeking a hard-working, driven individual with a desire to maximize any opportunity that offers unlimited earning potential. Only individuals with an entrepreneurial mindset that desire limitless opportunities should apply. Responsible for establishing a new business as well as expanding existing client base of dealerships in assigned territory, while promoting Copart Dealer "Remarketing" Services Possess the ability to continuously develop prospects, leads, and new sales opportunities Able to grasp new concepts quickly and to effectively communicate the Copart Dealer Terms & Conditions of Service to customers and prospective customers Create, maintain, & provide accurate & timely sales forecasts for your assigned territory Work in a team-oriented fashion, supporting a unified approach to delivering customer solutions Excellent negotiation skills between multiple parties is a must as well as a proven track record of success at closing the deals Highly motivated and enthusiastic with strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills Ability to work well independently & as a team player to achieve aggressive sales quotas Must possess excellent time-management, organizational, & problem-solving skills Able to successfully work in a fast past environment and meet demanding deadlines Strong judgment is required to manage competing priorities, understand the scope and urgency of requests Possess a tremendous work ethic and strong analytical skills For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. The Accounting Manager is responsible for managing the day-to-day technical accounting activities for the company, detailed reviews of various balance sheet account reconciliations, monthly journal entry review, performance of ongoing SOX controls; assistance with SEC filings, research and drafting of technical memos, and other projects as assigned. Copart's Accounts Payable team is looking for a process and service oriented professional to assist with processing daily transactions. This position requires someone that enjoys multitasking in a team-oriented environment and is required to complete tasks accurately and timely with attention to detail. An extremely motivated national sales division is looking for a high-energy Administrative Assistant. This position is demanding and requires someone that enjoys multitasking in a team-oriented environment. We are a fast-growing sales team that consists of over 100 salespeople nationwide and in Canada. You will be required to support the salespeople out in the field, mid-level managers as well as corporate management. Strong communication skills are extremely important both over the phone and through emails. Completing all required tasks accurately and timely with attention to detail is imperative Required Skills Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Excellent verbal and written skills Strong organizational and planning skills Produce and distribute correspondence, letters, marketing materials, and training materials Assist in the preparation and management of regularly scheduled reports Coordinate and schedule travel as well as assist with the planning of local and national events Deliver excellent customer service both internally and externally Required Experience Proven administrative skills with at least 2+ years working experience Associates degree or higher Fluent in Spanish verbal and written - plus For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. The Administrative Assistant will be responsible for ensuring all customer support requests submitted by phone, email, and customer portal are completed in a timely manner. This person will also provide support for the various members of our National Sales Team. Completing all required tasks accurately and timely with attention to detail is imperative. Essential Duties Assess customers' needs and provide assistance and information on product features Prioritize and respond to incoming calls, emails, and Sales Team requests Remain knowledgeable on products and services offered Create and maintain inside and outside training material Sort/Action/File incoming emails via the shared mailbox Resolve customer issues by investigating problems, developing solutions, preparing reports Provide sales materials for meetings, such as presentations, flyers, and other documents Arrange and coordinate meeting rooms, teleconference setup, and other tasks related to client visits Work with account managers to ensure new customer instructions are communicated Take ownership of any general customer inquiry, allocate and confirm resolution for customer Assist in the preparation and management of regularly scheduled reports Deliver excellent customer service both internally and externally Required Skills And Experience Associate degree, or equivalent combination of education, experience, and training that provides the required knowledge and skills Minimum of six months experience in an administrative role Proficient presentation skills Excellent written and oral communication skills Problem-solving and decision-making, sound judgment Capable of delivering outstanding customer service Microsoft office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Are you looking for a fast-paced and professional corporate office environment that offers a nice blend of consistent day-to-day tasks and special one-time or recurring projects? How about an environment full of engaging personalities who are driven to produce with high levels of service across the board? Look no further! Copart partners with customers that have unique business interests which offers exciting challenges to meet standard goals and impress on new and constantly changing opportunities. Copart is the salvage auction industry leader. We are constantly reinventing our tech and procedures to give our customers both internally and externally the best service available by utilizing the latest computer technology. The Alternate Title Specialist investigates titling issues using decision making and problem-solving skills to move vehicles through the pipeline to Auction. This involves networking across the country with our field operations for best practices and processes, staying up-to-date with legislative changes impacting the vehicle titling industry, and utilizing virtual multi-platform databases including government DMV/BMV third party sites. Responsibilities Utilize decision making and problem-solving skills to free up aged insurance claim vehicle inventory. Troubleshooting and problem resolution specific to vehicle titles; odometer discrepancies, power of attorney, etc. Ability to understand and apply all DMV laws, rules and regulations concerning insurance claim vehicles. Efficiently and accurately identify/analyze/process ownership documents within company and state alternate special transfer guidelines. Starting pay $18.00 hour Efficiently and accurately identify/analyze vehicle title/ownership documents within company guidelines Provide excellent customer service to all internal and external customers Process vehicle titles in accordance with state guidelines Research missing and/or incorrect title paperwork and determine proper resolve in a timely manner Communicate with customers via email or verbally to handle title issues daily Build a relationship and develop a professional rapport with DMV and sellers Maintain title bin filing as necessary Performs other duties as assigned HS diploma One-year vehicle title processing Computer proficiency (MS Office Word / Suite) Typing speed 45 words per minute Title knowledge of local and surrounding states is preferred. Must be able to work overtime schedule as needed Notary license preferred Bilingual a plus For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. The Asset Management Technician is responsible for implementing operational Installation, Services, Changes at the Campus, Offices and remote Copart yards. These changes include, but are not limited to operational growth, Windows imaging, Android and IOS imaging, decommission, inventory tracking and hardware deployment. This position also shares in the responsibilities of the day-to-day support for all Copart corporate support. Imaging Windows Systems Imaging Android and IOS mobile devices Track, update and resolve tickets in the Helpdesk Ticketing system. Document and update all equipment, printers, PC, UPS. Manage inventory and documentation for all equipment in the Campus and the Field. Install and support all IT devices used at the Campus, offices and Yard and includes: PC's, Mobility devices and Infrastructure components. Provide assistance on IT projects as directed, including but not limited to research, configuration, and deployment. Coordinate operational yard and Campus changes, adds, moves, integrations, to meet business needs. Create and compile documents to update projects in Copart's SharePoint site. Coordinate with Copart's desktop support teams on purchasing, configuring and shipping all PC equipment to the project yard or corporate sites. Procure and configure all network and desktop equipment for the yards and campus. Coordinate with the yards site contact on the arrival of the IT equipment and Copart team to site. Review inventory of the IT equipment with the site contact at the project yard or site. Assist with the installation of the network and PC equipment any projects at the yards, Campus or remote sites. Conduct tests on all PC equipment, ET2000, PCs, printer overrides to verify connectivity to the network. Finalize all the job scope tasks before project yard or site's opening day Deploy CAT trailer equipment as directed by Copart IT & Operations Department. Must be self-motivated, able to work independently and possess/demonstrate good judgment in stressful situations. Familiar with ticket-based support Individual must have excellent attention to detail and organizational skills. Familiar with network and PC equipment: physical installations i.e. set up of PCs, printers, and mobile devices. Individual must be able to work with Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and to complete basic tasks. Must possess excellent communication and customer services skills in order to work with vendors and Copart employees. Individual must be able to lift 50 pound items repeatedly Must have an understanding of Windows systems. Preferred Skills Possess excellent project management skills. Possess a high degree of understanding and knowledge of PC systems(Windows), Office applications and basic networking. Education May require an associate degree or its equivalent and at least 5 years' experience in the field or in related area For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. The Assistant General Manager will assist the General Manager in managing the overall Planning, Organizing, Leading, and Controlling (P-O-L-C) functions of the facility. In addition, the Assistant General Manager will assist the General Manager in managing aspects of the P-O-L-C framework with the goal of leading the facility and staff to meet budget, revenue, and customer satisfaction standards. Through a thorough understanding of Copart policies and practices, the Assistant General Manager will offer hands on support to the team and create a customer first environment by offering unique and innovative solutions to customer's needs while maintaining company standards for policy, quality, and service. P&L responsibility- assist GM with review of both revenue and costs on a monthly basis for accuracy and opportunities Assist GM to hire, train and develop staff to meet company guidelines Assist the GM in managing the day-to-day operations of the facility including staff management, customer and employee issues as needed Assist GM in Audit of facility to confirm and enforce compliance with internal procedures as well as accordance with county, state, EPA and OSHA regulations Build relationships with members and sellers to manage customer satisfaction Assist GM in tracking and leading facility staff to meet company metrics Provide direction to team regarding duties and goals Pay Rate: $69,902.00 - $87,309.00 Minimum of two years' experience as a manager in a logistics, distribution or operations environment Proven track record of seamless operational functionality and achievement of corporate goals at the AGM level or higher. Ability to solve complex problems and issues Strong analytical skills to interpret and forecast financial budgets Ability to develop, recommend and implement plans for continuous process improvement Strong leadership experience and skills Excellent interpersonal skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Great customer relations skills and experience Four year college degree preferred Proficient in all areas of Microsoft office Experience managing a staff of five or more people Bilingual skill a plus Valid driver's license For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. About Copart We are an S&P 500 company and the #1 global leader in online vehicle auctions. Our innovative technology and online auction platform links sellers to more than 750,000 Members in over 170 countries. We offer services to process and sell used, wholesale and salvage vehicles to dealers, dismantlers, rebuilders, exporters and end users. We sell vehicles on behalf of insurance companies, banks, finance companies, charities, fleet operators, dealers and individual owners. With operations at over 200 locations in 11 countries, we have more than 175,000 vehicles available online every day. About The Product Management Team (for Member Experiences) The Member Experience Product Management at Copart is responsible for understanding the needs of the various customer segments, prioritizing improvements and shaping new requirements to build better awareness, acquire, (re)activate, engage and drive users to perform core actions on the auction platform using web and mobile experiences. The changes proposed needs to be backed up by qualitative or quantitative insights gathered from user testing, interviews, analytics, competitive research, behavioral research, UX research, etc., The team's initiatives typically revolve around building better awareness, improving membership conversion, nudging members to visit inventory matching to their needs, engaging with search/lot detail views, building trust through transparency, improving pre-bid and live-auction participation, winning and achieving a good customer satisfaction score. About The Role We expect the APM Intern to bring an entrepreneurial mindset with strong technical understanding, product sense, analytical ability, and clear communication skills. Duties Passion for analyzing products, customer needs, and market dynamics Interest and skills in translating customer insights into actionable deliverables (one-pager business briefs and PRDs) for our engineering teams and collaborate with Design team members to create corresponding Design specs Interest in thinking from multiple perspectives, including our customers and development teams Be able to commit to a full-time (40hrs / week) internship (and commit to minimum of 3 months and ideally extend to 6 months) Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program Requirements Currently enrolled or recently graduated with a degree in Engineering or Product Management, Computer Science, or related Skills or experience in Business Analysis, Business Analysis, Product Development, Engineering Management, Consulting, Innovation or related Strong working knowledge or experience in competitive research, writing PRDs, creating business briefs, collaborating with UX and Engineering Teams Familiarity with common user journey and business analytics is recommended Demonstrated skills in being detail oriented, organized and exceptional communication and presentation skills For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. About The Role Copart is on the hunt for a passionate, analytical, Bank Reconciliation clerk to join our team. Qualified candidates must have prior Bank Reconciliation experience, must have basic accounting skills, must have accurate data entry skills, and must be organized and detail-oriented. Essential Duties Monitor banking activities to detect irregularities, including identifying and resolving discrepancies. Independently identify, research and resolve exceptions/differences. Work with other departments as needed. Maintain complete and accurate documentation. Prepare and post cash related journal entries to general ledger. Manage and audit local depository cash in logs for accuracy. Complete various month end and quarter end supporting schedules. Use cash management programs for various banks. Complete other ad hoc duties as requested Required Skills And Experience High School Diploma or GED equivalent required. Bachelor's degree preferred. Minimum one to two years of experience in treasury, accounting or finance environment preferred. Self-motivated, proactive individual with strong work ethic that is detail oriented with the ability to multitask and manage competing deadlines. Exceptional analytical reasoning skills to think problems through and generate solutions. Strong interpersonal skills along with excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as the willingness to work in a team oriented environment. Proficient in MS Office with strong Excel skills. About Copart We are an S&P 500 company and the #1 global leader in online vehicle auctions. Our innovative technology and online auction platform links sellers to more than 750,000 Members in over 170 countries. We offer services to process and sell used, wholesale and salvage vehicles to dealers, dismantlers, rebuilders, exporters and end users. We sell vehicles on behalf of insurance companies, banks, finance companies, charities, fleet operators, dealers, and individual owners. With operations at over 200 locations in 11 countries, we have more than 175,000 vehicles available online every day. About The Marketing Team This is an exciting time for the Marketing department of Copart. We are primarily responsible for driving growth, helping members become active buying cars in online auctions, and retaining/re-engaging members to come back and buy more. Digital marketing levers are a big part of our portfolio of tools including SEM, SEO, Merchandising/Promotions, Email/Push Notification communications (CRM), etc. In addition, we are an international operation, supporting multiple country sites and customer centers. About The Role The Brand Marketing Manager will lead key marketing initiatives that drive buyer behavior and membership acquisitions. This individual will craft the marketing strategy for a number of Copart brands. He/she will data analytics/reporting for Brand and retention Marketing campaigns. In addition, the brand marketing manager will be the expert on Buyer behavior and buyer activities working cross-functionally to understand all segments of buyers. He/she will lead all video production for members/buyers. Launch and maintain current customer surveys, lead a variety of promotional campaigns, be responsible for the Buyer/Member Advisory Board, produce corporate brochures and presentations. and will oversee the social media marketing team. This person will work with various teams to ensure the Copart message is accurately disseminated worldwide. The ideal candidate will have a background in marketing, communications or similar. This candidate will have a passion for learning and won't be afraid to roll up their sleeves to get the job done. This individual will work out of our Dallas Headquarters and will report to the VP of Marketing. He/She will manage 3-5 employees. Essential Duties Brand Management: Manage the Copart Brand strategy building and promoting the Copart brand with employees, in the community and with external stakeholders (seller, members, shareholders); develop brand style guides, personas, and buyer, category and brand profiles Surveys: Lead internal and external survey program and analysis utilizing the information to make informed recommendations to the business; Conduct research studies, focus groups, and present key findings; report findings to the operations team and executives monthly Promotional Marketing: Works on the planning, implementation and development of new marketing ideas and promotions, including vehicle promotions, launch of new locations, promotion of features/functionality for mobile and web Buyer Advocate: Develop strategies for member and buyer retention and tracking, and utilize surveys and other materials / campaigns to engage and retain members; leads the Buyer Advisory Board and reports back to executives on the findings and recommendations Paid Advertising: Responsible for meeting acquisition goals tied to paid advertising efforts which includes trade publications, radio or billboards, digital ads, social media and influencer marketing. Data and Analytics: Ability to tell a story with data; pull data and report on results of campaigns; complete all monthly and quarterly reports Creative Brand Development: Work with creative team to design Copart assets; lead all development of company brand creative, collateral, print material, ads, videos, etc. Campaign management: Direct planning, execution and reporting working cross-functionally with other areas within the marketing department. Vendor Management: Manage survey vendors, outside graphic designers and print production companies People Management: Develop/encourage teams Required Skills And Experience Bachelor's degree and/or 4-10 years' experience in marketing, communications, journalism, or general business Good knowledge of general marketing communications functions, including copywriting, advertising, social media, graphic design, video production and analytics Intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft products include Excel and PowerPoint Must be comfortable building and using pivot tables Experience in developing brand profiles and/or customer journeys 1-3 years in survey programs such as Qualtrics, Survey Monkey (for Business), or similar Experience in Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics a plus Strong writing skills with the ability to write blogs, website copy, business plans and presentations Basic HTML experience preferred Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, combined with the ability to balance multiple tasks simultaneously while meeting deadlines Previous experience managing employees Bilingual/Bicultural (Spanish) a plus For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. The Title Specialist will be responsible for the daily processing of vehicle titles. Through a thorough understanding of corresponding state and local title processing regulations and Copart policies, the Title Specialist will answer questions; provide support and facilitate the Copart experience through offering solutions to meet customers' needs. In addition, the Title Specialist will maintain file documentation, update customers on file status, and maintain accurate records of vehicle titling within company guidelines. The Title Specialist will be the face of the company through face-to-face and vocal interactions with all levels of customers which range from the general public to high-level managers of organizations. This is a permanent position on the CAT Team. You will need to be available to deploy with little notice (typically 24 hrs) and remain deployed for extended periods of time. Travel up to 75-90% of the year, with paid per diem and bonus when traveling. Must have valid driver's license and capable of air travel. Efficiently and accurately identify/analyze vehicle title/ownership documents within company guidelines. Provide excellent customer service to all internal and external customers. Process vehicle titles in accordance with state guidelines. Research missing and/or incorrect title paperwork and determine proper resolve in a timely manner. Communicate with customers via email or verbally to handle title issues daily. Build relationships and develop a professional rapport with DMV and sellers. Maintain title bin filing as necessary. Performs other duties as assigned. HS diploma. Two years customer service experience. One year vehicle title processing. Computer proficiency (MS Office Word / Suite). Typing speed 45 words per minute. Basic 10 Key proficiency. Excellent customer service skills and attitude. Excellent communication skills - verbal and written. Must be able to work under pressure and meet time sensitive deadlines. Must be able to multi-task. Must be able to work independently with little supervision. Must be able to view a computer screen for a significant portion of the work day. Strong attention to detail. Title knowledge of local and surrounding states is preferred. Strong organizational skills. Numeric and alphabetic filing skills are mandatory. Must be able to work overtime schedule as needed. Notary license preferred. Bilingual a plus. Occasional overtime as needed. For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. The CSR provides general administrative support while multi-tasking in hectic and stressful situations. In addition, the CSR will be the face of the Company through face to face and vocal interactions with all levels of customers which range from the general public to high level managers of organizations. Receive and process payments. Update lot (vehicle) notes in the system. Answer multi-line telephone in a professional manner. Face to face customer interaction. Use company resources to gather information and offer solutions to meet customer needs. Contact clients to obtain vehicle pick-up information. File documents according to criteria. Process mail incoming and outgoing per criteria. Read and interpret various reports and documents. Proper completion of sale documents. Other duties as assigned. One year of office support experience in a customer service role preferred High School diploma Excellent customer service skills and attitude Excellent written and verbal skills Proficient with office equipment Attention to detail Problem-solving Computer proficiency - MS Suite Typing speed 45WPM Professional appearance Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Bilingual skills a plus Occasional overtime as needed Pay starts at $18.00 an hour For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family - it's like coming home. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

The Remote Customer Service Representative (CSR) provides exceptional customer service to internal and external customers of Copart. Through a thorough understanding of Copart practices, the CSR offers solutions that aid and facilitate a unique customer service experience. The primary function of this role is to obtain the release of vehicles that are located at body shops and/or other locations including residences. In addition to other office support functions as needed. The CSR is the face of the Company as they are often the first interaction our customers have with Copart. Contact body shops to obtain vehicle pick-up information and gain verbal release to pick up vehicle(s). May interact with vehicle owners via phone to help in the release of vehicles. May interact with Insurance Companies to help expedite the vehicle clearing process. Answer and place calls in a professional manner. Measured on call quality -- (Knowledge, level of professionalism, time to place follow-up calls) Focus on a "1st call resolution". File quality -- any work done on a specific file (lot) -- accuracy, and time in process. Other remote tasks as assigned or needed by the business such as, but not limited to, working escalated files, and assisting other teams. Use company resources to gather information and offer solutions to meet customer needs. Update lot (vehicle) notes in the system Other duties as assigned. One year of office support experience in a customer service role preferred High School diploma Excellent customer service skills and attitude Excellent written and verbal skills Proficient with office equipment Attention to detail Problem-solving Computer proficiency - MS Suite Typing speed 45WPM Professional appearance Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Bilingual skills a plus Occasional overtime as needed Pay starts at $20.03 an hour For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. The Data Engineer will be part of the Data Services Team. The Data Services team works very closely with all aspects of applications and data pipelines. We are looking for a Data Engineer to design, develop, and optimize the flow of data throughout the organization, enabling end user to provide valuable insights of data across Copart. In this role, your work will broadly influence the company's data consumers, executives and analysts. Key Responsibilities Design and build the next generation data platform Develop and automate data processing systems to deliver data insights at an enterprise scale. Develop logging, metrics, and alerts that enable active monitoring of designed processes. Collaborate with Product Managers and Application teams to develop data models and schemas that help provide easy access to complex data sets. Assist in maintaining data integrity in production systems Ability to balance and prioritize multiple conflicting requirements with high attention to detail. Qualifications Requirements Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, Engineering or similar 3+ years of experience designing, developing, testing and implementing scalable, high-performing data warehouse and BI solutions Good hands-on Experience on real-time data pipelines including Kinesis and Kafka , understanding of Database architecture including MPP and ad-hoc analysis using BI/Analytical tools like Tableau, Pentaho, OBIEE or Power BI Proven ability to analyze complex business problems using data and translate them into actionable insights stemming from data analysis Experience with ETL and Data Blending and Transformation tools such as Pentaho Data Integrator, Talend Data Integration, Informatica Enterprise development knowledge and/or experience with databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL and Columnar databases like Vertica, MemSQL , Netezza , Redshift Good understanding of technology and industry and able to make decisions on the best technology for integrated solutions Proven ability to communicate with business and technical audiences at all levels, including demonstrated success influencing senior leaders and decision makers Technical Skill Required: SQL, Python. BI/Analytical Tool Preferred: Tableau, Pentaho, PowerBI For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. Copart is looking for a data scientist who will work closely with Tech and various other departments to drive insight into data and deliver machine learning solutions to improve Copart's operations. This data scientist will also design/manipulate large-scale data sets from a multitude of sources, work to operationalize and integrate machine learning solutions into Copart's current products and visualize and report on findings and results to provide insight to the organization. Job Duties Develop new predictive models using advanced techniques Apply critical thinking to ensure data integrity and quality control is applied to each dataset, model, and other analysis prior to presenting with internal customers Coordinate with different functional teams to operationalize, and monitor machine learning solutions Apply statistical methodologies such as cluster and regression analysis, if necessary. Act as a proponent of data science/analytics to senior leadership and others by being able to explain the benefits of machine learning, and other techniques. Required Skills & Experience 2 years of experience (relevant academic internships & projects can be considered in lieu of professional experience) with machine learning, statistical modeling, and data mining techniques. Bachelor or Master's degree in a highly quantitative field (computer science, mathematics, machine learning, statistics) or equivalent experience Proficiency in either R or Python (Python preferred) Proficiency in data sourcing/manipulation in SQL Experience applying various machine learning techniques, specifically neural networks and gradient boosted machines, and understanding the key parameters that affect their performance Strong data visualization skills using open source tools (seaborns, matplotlib, plotly, ggplot2, shiny) Experience with both supervised and unsupervised modeling techniques Confidence in presenting to a non-technical audience Industry experience in logistics is preferred For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

This DevOps Engineer will be a critical member of Copart's growing DevOps team and will be responsible for Production Support and keeping our sites up and running. This will include automating deployments, configuration management and capacity management of Copart's production applications. This role will interact with all functions in Copart's technology team to build out operational capabilities to support secure, scalable, fault-tolerant and cloud-based web applications and architecture. Essential Duties Build, maintain, and troubleshoot one or more company products Develop internal tools and processes to maintain stability and performance of our infrastructure Act as subject-matter expert for one or more company products Gather, analyze, and report important IT system data Provide feedback to developers regarding the status of various IT systems Develop and manage product-related IT procedures Research, review, analyze, troubleshoot, and document product-related IT systems Plan and successfully complete IT projects and goals Excellent presentation, verbal and written communication skills including the ability to produce usable and maintainable documentation Strong work ethic, attention to detail, and drive to be successful; ability to work independently with minimal supervision or assistance Strong interpersonal, time management, project management, and conflict resolution skills Strong problem-solving skills: innovation, collaboration, analysis, inductive reasoning Automate repetitive tasks Requirements Very good knowledge and experience supporting secure, scalable, fault-tolerant, and cloud-based web applications and architecture Extensive production support experience in troubleshooting and problem-solving issues to keep our applications/platforms resilient and highly available Good experience in writing custom applications/scripts to enhance support capabilities Good experience in automation of deployments, configuration management, capacity management and providing custom solutions based on our customer needs in an agile environment Proficient with standard IT concepts, practices, and procedures Intermediate programming and scripting knowledge Strong understanding of business processes and IT systems Strong knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems Thorough understanding of Systems, TCP/IP networking and DNS concepts including setup/configuration of CDNs (Cloudflare, Akamai, etc.) is a plus Experience with web technologies and web/application servers like Apache, Tomcat, WebLogic, Nginx, Redis, SOLR, Universal Messaging (Nirvana), WSO2 is a must Experience with Build Automation, CI/CD and DevOps Tools like GitHub, Jenkins, Maven, Gradle, Nexus, Ansible, Puppet and StackStorm is a must Experience working and deploying applications in container technologies (Docker), Cloud environments (AWS, GCP) and Kubernetes platform is a plus Experience in monitoring applications performance and predicting degradation of service using APM Tools like AppDynamics, Instana, New Relic etc. and improve application performance to avoid interruptions to service Experience Handling escalations from the L1 and L2 teams to troubleshoot various infrastructure components that range from infrastructure issues to application-level issues Analyzing issues to find the Root Cause and providing the teams with the corrective and preventive actions Good experience in security hardening and security vulnerability management and patching For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. The dispatcher is responsible for the timely and accurate dispatch of sub-haulers for vehicle pick-up and delivery while providing excellent service to customers. Outbound calls to pick-up locations. Dispatch sub-haulers for vehicle pick-up and delivery within company timelines. Ensure sub-haulers meet company requirements prior to dispatching. Outbound calls to sellers. Solicit business. Utilize cost effective vendors to meet company budget objectives. Educate sub-haulers on company policies and procedures. Maintain and archive documents. Answer phone calls. Collect payments on member deliveries. Comply with Safety and enforce regulations. Print checks. Monitor incoming documents on the fax machine. Print reports as needed. Manage vendor relationships. Other duties as assigned. Two years dispatch experience. One year customer service skills experience. High School Diploma or GED preferred. Excellent customer service skills and attitude. Excellent Communication Skills - verbal and written. Excellent organizational skills. Excellent time management skills. Typing speed 45 words per minute. Basic Ten key proficiency. Basic Math skills. Computer proficiency (MS Suite experience). Ability to operate office equipment. Multi-tasking. Ability to work in fast-paced/diverse environment. Strong attention to detail. Know geographical area as well as ability to read maps. Work with minimal supervision. Occasional Overtime as needed. Bilingual Skill a plus. Pay starting at $21.05 an hour For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. The DMV Specialist will be responsible for the daily processing of vehicle titles. Through a thorough understanding of corresponding state and local title processing regulations and Copart policies, the DMV Specialist will answer questions; provide support and facilitate the Copart experience through offering solutions to meet customer's needs. In addition, the DMV Specialist will maintain file documentation, update customers on the file status, and maintain accurate records of vehicle titling within company guidelines. The DMV Specialist will be the face of the company through face to face and vocal interactions with all levels of customers which range from the general public to high-level managers of organizations. Efficiently and accurately identify/analyze vehicle title/ownership documents within company guidelines Provide excellent customer service to all internal and external customers Process vehicle titles in accordance with state guidelines Research missing and/or incorrect title paperwork and determine proper resolve in a timely manner Communicate with customers via email or verbally to handle title issues daily Build a relationship and develop a professional rapport with DMV and sellers Maintain title bin filing as necessary Performs other duties as assigned HS diploma One-year vehicle title processing Computer proficiency (MS Office Word / Suite) Typing speed 45 words per minute Title knowledge of local and surrounding states is preferred. Must be able to work overtime schedule as needed Notary license preferred Bilingual a plus For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. The Equipment Operator will be responsible for maintaining the yard and entire facility. In addition, operator will maintain a safe work environment and be required to follow and be held accountable to company guidelines for safe equipment operation. Finally, through a thorough understanding of Copart policy, the Equipment Operator will facilitate The Vantage Truck Parking experience by offering solutions to meet customer's needs. Operator will assist manager in all yard function, customer service, cleanliness, and maintenance. Ensures equipment is maintained according to company standards Operates company equipment safely Assists with the maintenance of company equipment and vehicles Verifies authorized access for all vehicles entering the lot Takes payments in accordance with company guidelines and procedures Ensures that security measures are in place and functional Monitors and enforces yard rules Routinely removes trash and debris from the lot Positive attitude/High Integrity. Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Strong attention to detail. Occasional O.T. as needed. Provides excellent service to customers as needed Maintains a positive and professional demeanor Follows yard guidelines to maintain a safe working environment (i.e. speed limits, etc.). Must be able to perform basic computer skills Performs other duties as assigned. HS diploma or GED preferred. At least two years of work experience, preferably in an outdoor environment. One year of loader or forklift experience, certification preferred. Excellent customer service attitude and skills. Excellent communication skills written and verbal. Bilingual skills a plus. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

The ideal candidate will have broad management experience in the operation and maintenance of construction equipment, specifically wheel loaders. This experience should include; relationship building with OEM's and their dealers, repair evaluation and decision making, invoice oversight and approval, purchase/ replacement evaluation and managing warranty and policy programs. In addition, the ability to teach basic operation and equipment maintenance to company employees is essential. The position requires a solid understanding of industrial safety. Being familiar with OSHA's General Industry section (29CFR1910) is essential. Researching Federal, State and Local agency regulations is an ongoing activity. To a lesser extent the position calls for environmental knowledge and experience. Specific areas would include, fuel storage tank regulations, hazardous material regulations and storm water regulations. In all areas public speaking is central to the position. The candidate must be comfortable teaching the technical aspects of equipment operation, maintenance, safety policy and programs and environmental compliance. Presentations will be made to all levels from hourly to executive both internally and externally. Must be proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) and Outlook. Time management skills commensurate with an offsite position with minimal direct supervision. 50%+ travel. Responsibility includes 26-32 yards spread over several states in the East. May require extended travel for events like company expansion and catastrophe response. Requires above average communication skills including writing (memo, presentations, correspondence, and email) and verbal skills including leading group training sessions, teaching and training during field visits. 3-5 years' experience maintaining/operating construction equipment. Experience with safety programs in an industrial setting. Familiarity with OSHA General Industry Standards to include; Powered Industrial Trucks, Haz-Com, PPE and Blood Borne Pathogen Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

The Field Engineer is responsible for implementing operational Installation, Services, and Changes at the Corporate HQ, Offices and remote Copart yards. These changes include, but are not limited to Office support, operational growth, yard moves, remodels, decommission, and all aspects of IT Support. The Field Technician position may requires some travel for various Copart projects. This position also shares in the responsibilities of the day-to-day support for all Copart's main HDQ, Offices, and Copart yards, working with subcontractors, the service desk Desks and various IT teams. Duties Remotely assist with installs, troubleshoots, repairs of all network, desktop & voice equipment at any Copart sites. Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot data circuits and provide assistance to the WAN Service provider to resolve/repair data circuits. Report all circuit outages or project scope changes to the End User Computer Manager. Initiate tickets with the appropriate vendors for any break/fix issue that may occur in the yards or Campus. Track, update and resolve tickets in the Helpdesk Ticketing system. Document and update all equipment, PC, ET2000, printers, PC, UPS and any such IT Equipment. Manage inventory and documentation for all equipment in the Campus and the Field Install and support all IT devices used at the Campus, offices and Yard and includes PC's, Servers, Voice and Voip Equipment, Mobility devices and Infrastructure components. Aid on IT projects as directed, including but not limited to research, configuration, and deployment. Coordinate operational yard and Campus changes, adds, moves, integrations, to meet business needs. Create and compile documents to update projects in Copart's SharePoint site Determine and design the best locations for infrastructure wiring on the floor plans. Coordinate with Copart Telecom services department to cancel or delete telecommunications services for all yards, projects and offices Coordinate with various vendors to get the appropriate quotes for Copart projects. Coordinate with Copart's desktop support team on purchasing, configuring and shipping all PC equipment to the project yard or site. Purchase and configure all network and desktop equipment for the yards and campus. Coordinate with the yards site contact on the arrival of the IT equipment and Copart team to site. Review inventory of the IT equipment with the site contact at the project yard or site. Survey the Offices, or any Copart sites, and report all discrepancies to the End User Computing Manager Obtain approval from the End User Computing Manager before making changes to the floorplan or job scope. Verify all telecommunication circuits and phone lines are operational. Expedite all Telecom issues to the Telecom services department. Assist with the installation of the network and PC equipment any projects at the yards , Cmapus or remote sites. Provision all global and local overrides for the devices at the project yard or site. Conduct tests on all PC equipment, ET2000, PCs, printer overrides to verify connectivity to the network. Finalize all the job scope tasks before project yard or site's opening day Resolve all IT related questions or issues the yard or site might have on opening day. Other duties as assigned Required Skills Individual must have a basic knowledge of Telecommunications installations, ( phones, PBX , LAN cabling and data circuits) Must be self-motivated, able to work independently and possess/demonstrate good judgment in stressful situations. Individual must have excellent attention to detail and organizational skills. Familiar with network and PC equipment physical installations i.e. set up of switches, PCs, printers and AS400 terminals Individual must be able to work with Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Visio to complete basic tasks. Must possess excellent communication and customer services skills in order to work with services providers, vendors and Copart employees. Individual must be able to lift 20 pound items repeatedly Must have an understanding of cabling infrastructure practices, procedures and standards. Preferred Skills Possess excellent project management skills. Possess a high degree of understanding and knowledge of data networking and telecommunication. For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Under the direction of the European - Finance Systems Manager, the Finance Systems Analyst will assist in implementing new and updating existing Finance systems. Developing and improving functionality Facilitate ad-hoc projects as the business makes new acquisitions, such as the roll-out of Navision to countries. Working closely with Tech located in the US Ensure system permissions are in line with delegated authorities and approval limits and ensure the segregation of duties Systems administration Provide a consistent and approachable point of contact for European countries -- Germany, Spain, and Finland, but not limited to. Business partnering with end-users Test internal processes and procedures once confirmed to be documented Provide training and support to Finance users for key Finance systems Required Skills And Experience Strong accountancy/finance background Must have a Finance Technology background. Strong communication skills Exposure to system administration Demonstrated ability to improve processes to ensure the best use of the system's functionality UAT experience. 2 to 3 years required working as a Finance Systems Accountant, Finance Systems Analyst Evidence of role in previous projects Hard-working with good attention to detail Ability to keep calm under pressure, retain a positive attitude, and meet tight deadlines Good understanding and use of Excel to perform the role Knowledge of Microsoft Navision/Concur/ OneStream would be advantageous. jobTitle: Flex Force - Truck & Trailer Driver Class A
jobDescription: Copart is now seeking truck/transport drivers, in select markets, for their newly delivered fleet of Trucks and 4 and 5 car Hot-Shot Trailers. These drivers will support the local Copart facility in moving vehicles to other Copart yards and for customer pickups and deliveries. During a special project or catastrophe, the drivers will be deployed to various locations across the country to assist in Catastrophe Response (hurricane, hail, flooding). Overnight travel is expected to be 25% of the time and catastrophe response travel will be mandatory. Are you looking for competitive? Hard work pays off. The right person could earn up to $80,000, + bonuses if deployed, with our commission-based pay. While running transport, drivers will support increased volume and increased commission pay. Are you looking for a company that appreciates you and rewards you for your hard work? Copart started in 1982 and has been an industry leader in innovation and service, is part of the S&P 500, has an incredible culture with talented and diverse employees, and is ready for you to start a career with endless opportunities. What do we want you to bring to the table? We are looking for professional, hardworking, focused, team players that are willing to bring their best. Towing, Transport, heavy equipment experience and Class A driver's license. What we will bring to the table? We have everything you need to get started - Newly delivered trucks and 4 and 5-car transports, insurance, training, and advancement opportunities. Copart offers health insurance (vision, dental available), life insurance, 401k match, employee assistance program, flexible spending account, paid time off, and our employee stock purchase program! Responsibilities And Duties Must be willing to travel nationally on short notice -- Catastrophe deployments will be mandatory Daily meal allowance paid while traveling Weekly Bonus while traveling Piece Rate based pay while transporting Competitive pay when not transporting Must meet background screening criteria Local pick-up and delivery of vehicles Load/unload vehicles safely and free of damage Operate company equipment in compliance with safety regulations Deploy to catastrophe events within 24 hours when directed to do so Maintain and assure good operating condition of all equipment and facilities Other tasks as assigned by the manager in support of daily auctions Skills & Experience Must be at least 21 years of age. Possess a CDL license (Copart will pay for and help obtain) One year commitment once CDL is paid for -- Repayment required if the year commitment is not met Must meet background screening criteria Excellent driving record Towing experience preferred HS diploma or GED preferred. One year of loader or forklift experience, certification preferred. Excellent customer service attitude and skills. Excellent communication skills, written and verbal. Positive attitude/High Integrity. Ability to operate heavy equipment. Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Strong attention to detail. Occasional O.T. as needed. Bilingual skills are a plus. Travel may be required Benefits Include Medical, Dental, & Vision 401 (K) Employee Stock Purchase Plan Flexible Spending Accounts and Health Savings Account Life & AD&D Physical Requirements STANDING: 30% LIFTING: 35 Pounds TEMPERATURE: Average temperature SITTING: 45% WALKING: 20% BENDING: 2% STOOPING: 2% CLIMBING: 0% NOISE LEVEL: Minimal TRAVEL: 50% For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. The General Manager is responsible for overall Planning, Organizing, leading, and controlling (P-O-L-C) functions of the facility. In addition, the General Manager will manage all aspects of the P-O-L-C framework with the goal of leading the facility and staff to meet budget, revenue, and customer satisfaction standards. Through a thorough understanding of Copart policies and practices, the General Manager will create a customer first environment for internal and external customers by offering unique and innovative solutions that meet customer needs while maintaining company standards for policy, quality, and service. Essential Duties Partners with HR to attract, recruit, develop and retain a diverse, high performing team Train and develop staff to meet company guidelines and expectations Ensure there is continual, positive communication and feedback with staff in addition to all annual Continuous Improvement Summaries (CIS -- Reviews) delivered timely Manages team through an innovative, creative, inspirational leadership style Ability to hold staff consistently accountable with unbiased fairness to help drive performance Create a highly engaged team environment which drives execution, innovation, productivity, and future leaders Holds self to a high level of integrity in all interactions and decision making Proactively manages performance of managers and staff to address all opportunities quickly, and to redirect or take appropriate action if applicable Manages the day-to-day operations of the facility including, but not limited to becoming a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in all process areas both in the office and with outside yard jobs and tasks Responsible for recruiting and maintaining appropriate number of sub-haulers to manage the logistical requirements of running a Copart facility properly and effectively Must remain within allowable compliance guidelines for any System Quality Reviews, Field Quality Reviews, and Equipment and Safety Reviews Must immediately raise any concerns that could negatively impact the facility, the employees, or customers up to the Regional Manager Set goals and ensures that each employee is leveraging the tools provided to them to achieve continual success Ensure your locations are compliant with laws and regulations to include county, state, EPA, OSHA, and Department of Motor Vehicle regulations Disseminate pertinent knowledge throughout location to all employees to ensure transparency and clarity on company goals and initiatives Responsible for customer relationships (buyers, sellers, and internal customers) Identifying knowledge and skill gaps amongst your team and ensure there are remedies for said gaps Brand ambassador of the company's mission, vision, values, and culture Ability to communicate to all levels of leadership throughout the organization with tact and professionalism both written and verbal May be called upon to support local or non-local CAT events throughout the year Accountable for understanding the assigned profit and Loss Statement. Identifying ways to increase revenue and decrease costs. Other duties as assigned by Regional Manager or a member of upper Management Minimum of 2-3 years as a manager, military or other relevant experience preferred Proven track record of driving and achieving operational excellence and execution of corporate goals Metric Driven Proven track record on supporting change initiatives and ensuring the team can easily adapt to, and manage the change effectively and with positivity Strong communication skills with the ability to adjust your tone/communication style according to your audience Strong relationship building skills Strong critical thinking skills using logic and help to identify alternative solutions to operational issues Strong decision-making skills -- will consider benefits and risks to potential decisions to choose the most appropriate course of action Strong listening skills -- takes the time to actively listen to issues or concerns to help develop and execute on the solution Able to manage time effectively and prioritize tasks to meet new deadlines or productivity goals Strong problem-solving skills Able to multi-task and stay positive and motivated with a strong sense of urgency Bi-lingual a plus Travel may be required Valid Driver's License Pay Starting at $68,900 For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family - it's like coming home. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

The Inventory Associate will be responsible for vehicle clean-up and general labor throughout the facility. The Inventory Associate will prep vehicles for inventory per company guidelines while maintaining company standards for accuracy and cleanliness of the vehicles. In addition, the Inventory Associate will perform general labor tasks for the facility which can include general facility clean up, minor repairs, and other duties. Finally, through a thorough understanding of Copart's practices, the Inventory Associate will help facilitate the Copart experience by providing excellent service to customers of Copart. The Inventory Specialist will be responsible for the inventory of all vehicles at the facility within company timelines. Through the use of company provided tools, the Inventory Specialist will document vehicle condition within company standards which includes a complete inventory and supporting photographs of each vehicle. In addition, by using a system of priorities, the Inventory Specialist will be responsible for directing the flow of traffic in the receiving area to ensure timely processing of vehicle inventory. Finally, through a thorough understanding of Copart policy, the Inventory Specialist will be responsible for facilitating the Copart experience by offering solutions to meet customer's needs. Copart (NASDAQ:CPRT), a global online auto auction company with operations in 11 countries, has an immediate opening for a Land Acquisition Specialist at our global headquarters located in Dallas, Texas. Listed on the NASDAQ since 1994, Copart is a top-performing S&P 500 company, a Fortune 1000 and Fortune Future 50 company, and a technology innovator. Copart connects sellers with 750,000+ buyers from more than 170 countries. Our diverse and extensive inventory features more than 160,000 vehicles available online every day. Copart specializes in the resale and remarketing of used, wholesale, and salvage title automobiles. They seek dedicated, hardworking employees in a team to make an impact in the outside world. Job Description The Land Acquisition Specialist will be responsible for (a) identifying property locations that meet the company's requirements and strategic growth plan and (b) negotiating the purchase or lease terms for the acquisition of the same. The employee will work closely with executives in executing the Company's strategic property plan. This is a great opportunity for a motivated individual to join the world's largest and most-respected vehicle auction company. Job Description Identify, research, and present potential on and off-market real estate opportunities and negotiate acquisition terms. Generate acquisition opportunities in the assigned markets by developing trusted relationships with industry contacts, including brokers, developers, and owners. Research and determine whether the intended use is allowed or attainable under local law. Collaborate with the in-house development team to determine site feasibility. Work closely with in-house legal counsel to draft and negotiate a letter of intent and provide all necessary deal points to generate acquisition documents. Participate in due diligence, zoning, and land planning process. Potential to coordinate with consultants and principals regarding same. All other duties as determined by company management Required Skills And Experience Strong negotiation and organization skills Strong attention to detail and ability to handle multiple projects efficiently Exceptional verbal and written communication skills The ideal candidate will have at least 2+ years' experience in the property acquisition field Knowledge and experience of land use, zoning process, and use permit applications a plus Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications Pay Range Minimum: $64,200 For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Provides service to customers as needed. Maintains a positive and professional demeanor. Follows yard guidelines to maintain a safe working environment (i.e. speed limits, etc.). Must be able to load and unload vehicles as required. Must be able to pass training and safety requirements. Performs other duties as assigned. HS diploma or GED preferred. At least two years of work experience, preferably in an outdoor environment. One year of loader or forklift experience, certification preferred. Excellent customer service attitude and skills. Excellent communication skills written and verbal. Positive attitude/High Integrity. Ability to operate heavy equipment. Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Strong attention to detail. Occasional O.T. as needed. Bilingual skills a plus. The Loader Operator will be responsible for moving and loading vehicles with a company-provided front-end loader or forklift. In addition, the Loader Operator will be required to maintain documentation of vehicle movement around the facility. Furthermore, the Loader Operator will be responsible for the daily pre and post-trip inspections and associated documentation of their assigned machine. In addition, the operator will maintain a safe work environment and be required to follow and be held accountable to company guidelines for safe loader operation. Finally, through a thorough understanding of Copart policy, the Loader Operator will facilitate the Copart experience by offering solutions to meet customers' needs. Ensures equipment is maintained according to company standards and customer contracts. Operates company equipment safely. Assists with the maintenance of company equipment and vehicles. Records vehicle information accurately and legibly. Operates digital camera or other basic vehicle documentation and tracking devices. Sets up yard for auctions within company timelines. Provides service to customers as needed. Maintains a positive and professional demeanor. Follows yard guidelines to maintain a safe working environment (i.e. speed limits, etc.). Must be able to load and unload vehicles as required. Must be able to pass training and safety requirements. Performs other duties as assigned. HS diploma or GED preferred. At least two years of work experience, preferably in an outdoor environment. One year of loader or forklift experience, certification preferred. Excellent customer service attitude and skills. Excellent communication skills written and verbal. Positive attitude/High Integrity. Ability to operate heavy equipment. Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Strong attention to detail. Occasional O.T. as needed. Bilingual skills a plus. Pay starting at $21.05 an hour For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. The Loader Operator will be responsible for moving and loading vehicles with a company-provided front-end loader or forklift. Strong attention to detail. Occasional O.T. as needed. Bilingual skills a plus. Strong attention to detail. Occasional O.T. as needed. Bilingual skills a plus. The Membership Sales Representative will focus on member acquisition and promoting membership upgrades to existing clients. We are looking for an extremely motivated and high energy sales agent. Strong communication skills over the phone are extremely important. Unlimited Earning Potential! Membership Sales Duties and Responsibilities Cold calling; making multiple outbound calls to clients (80+ calls/day). Understanding client needs and offering solutions and support. Presenting and delivering information to potential clients. Data Entry - Maintaining database (CRM, Excel, etc.) of prospective client information. Process sales orders. Other duties as assigned. One year of office support experience in a customer service role. Previous experience in an outbound call center, inside sales experience, or related sales experience preferred. Excellent verbal and written communication skills; the ability to call, connect, and interact with potential customers. Computer skills involving Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, and Excel) and CRM experience preferred. High school degree or equivalent. Fluent in Spanish, verbal and written -- a plus. The Office Coordinator will be responsible for duties required to support our CDS team members. Through a thorough understanding Copart policies, the Office Coordinator will answer questions; provide support and facilitate the Copart experience through offering solutions to meet customers' needs. In addition, the Office Coordinator will maintain file documentation, update customers on file status, and maintain accurate records of vehicle lots within company guidelines. The Office Coordinator will be the face of the company through face-to-face and vocal interactions with all levels of customers which range from the general public to high-level managers of organizations. Efficiently and accurately identify/analyze vehicle title/ownership documents within company guidelines. Provide excellent customer service to all internal and external customers. Process vehicle titles and other duties to support a unified effort in accordance with company and state guidelines. Resolve issues in a timely manner. Communicate with customers via email or verbally to handle title issues daily. Build relationships and develop a professional rapport with DMV and sellers. Performs other duties as assigned. Required Skills And Experience HS diploma. Two years of customer service experience. Computer proficiency (MS Office Word / Suite). Typing speed 45 words per minute. Basic 10 Key proficiency. Excellent customer service skills and attitude. Excellent communication skills - verbal and written. Must be able to work under pressure and meet time-sensitive deadlines. Must be able to multi-task and independently with little supervision. Must be able to view a computer screen for a significant portion of the workday. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Numeric and alphabetic filing skills are mandatory. Must be able to work overtime schedule as needed. Bilingual is a plus. Starting Pay Range $18.85 to $21/Hr For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Copart, Inc., founded in 1982, is a global leader in online vehicle auctions. Publicly traded and recently named as the top-performing company on the S&P 500, Copart's innovative technology and online auction platform links sellers to more than 750,000 Members in over 170 countries. With operations in over 200 locations in 11 countries, Copart has more than 125,000 vehicles available online every day. Copart is "change-centric," meaning we are never content to rest on our laurels, but continue to strive to find new and better ways to serve our customers and improve the industry. That philosophy means our employees are always striving to improve themselves, resulting in an innovative culture that doesn't just dream up ideas, but executes them well. Copart's real estate acquisition team is looking for a process- and service-oriented professional with strong communication and critical thinking skills to work with internal team and external vendors and partners to review and finalize title commitments and surveys and provide assistance with closings. Essential Duties Open title on properties under contract for purchase and prospective lease targets; title and survey review, correspondence with sellers, title companies and surveyors re comments and objections. Read and summarize recorded documents. Read contracts, calculate deadlines, and assist in deadline management. Request wires for earnest money deposits and extension fees. Draft documents using forms library. Review leases to prepare summaries and estoppel certificates. Take an active part in managing contract deadlines. Assist in gathering and distributing due diligence and obtaining approvals. Prepare closing documents, finalize title commitment and proforma, review settlement statement including confirmation of rent and tax prorations, and otherwise assist with closings. Maintain transactional information and checklists in various online applications, including thoughtful saving of documents and version control in online document management system. Research and resolve non-transactional issues, requests, and questions as assigned. Required Skills & Experience 4-7 years experience as a paralegal in a law firm or corporate legal department. Experience reviewing title and survey and closing commercial real estate transactions is preferred, but not required. Must be proficient with technology, including Adobe Pro or DC, Microsoft Outlook and other Office Suite products, and web-based database applications Excellent communication skills, oral and written Paralegal certificate or NFPA or NALA certification or commensurate experience preferred Strong attention to detail Able to manage multiple projects/tasks/vendors simultaneously For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family - it's like coming home.
