The Senior Cyber Security Engineer (Incident Response) is a subject matter expert in the operation of a wide range of security technologies as well as analyzing and responding to cyber security threats that actively target businesses today. This person will assist in commanding the first, and second lines of cyber defense for Copart‚Äôs information technology assets while having partial responsibility for oversight and escalations from an internal, multi-national, established, 24x7x365 incident response team. An ideal candidate must be capable in performing quality, in-depth forensic analysis of various malware, exploits, phishing attacks, malicious or suspicious network traffic and other cyber threats in a manner that would provide thorough and qualitive cyber defense adjustment recommendations as well as after action pro-active changes to security tools and information assets to better defend against future attacks. This person must be an adept in troubleshooting the operational aspect of various security technologies. Additionally, the candidate for this role must stay current on emerging threats, new security technologies as well as cyber defense tactics and techniques. This person must be a highly motivated individual with the ability to self-start, think outside the box, prioritize, multi-task and eager to coach and assist in the growth of other, more junior members of their team. Responsibilities & Tasks ‚Ä¢ Able to utilize emotional intelligence and business operation consideration when making cyber security related decisions. ‚Ä¢ Ability to command a team consisting of multiple non security technology departments (Help Desk, Network Engineering, DEVOPS, Systems Engineering and others) in scenarios where coordinated response is required. ‚Ä¢ Understanding of Threat Hunting and Threat Intelligence techniques. ‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge on Firewalls, DNS Filtering, EDR, IDS/IPS, Email Security, MFA, Active Directory and Networking. ‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Windows, Linux and OSX. ‚Ä¢ Understanding of virtualization and cloud technologies and how to apply cyber security. ‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of exploits, vulnerabilities, attacks, and countermeasures. ‚Ä¢ Assist in composing cyber security related communications for a wide audience. ‚Ä¢ Advising and coaching first and second level incident responders. ‚Ä¢ Responsible in assisting on metrics creation, reporting and presentation to senior leadership for incident response activities. ‚Ä¢ Act as subject matter expert for cyber security events and or incidents. ‚Ä¢ Ensure cyber security event SLA's are met across the team ‚Ä¢ Ability to provide qualitative audits for previous cyber events for internal improvement Required Knowledge / Experience / Qualities: ‚Ä¢ Schooling Requirement‚Äì High school equivalency or GED ‚Ä¢ Years of experience ‚Äì not a requirement ‚Ä¢ Certifications ‚Äì Good to have, not a requirement ‚Ä¢ Knowledge of network ports, protocols, and associated cyber security defense measures. ‚Ä¢ Understanding of web application security is a plus. ‚Ä¢ Strong written and oral communication skills. ‚Ä¢ Personality traits like critical thinking, strong team player, self-starter, eagerness to learn. ‚Ä¢ Ability to adjust and work in a very fast-paced environment.

Ability to command a team consisting of multiple non security technology departments (Help Desk, Network Engineering, DEVOPS, Systems Engineering and others) in scenarios where coordinated response is required. Understanding of Threat Hunting and Threat Intelligence techniques. Strong knowledge on Firewalls, DNS Filtering, EDR, IDS/IPS, Email Security, MFA, Active Directory and Networking. Familiarity with Windows, Linux and OSX. Understanding of virtualization and cloud technologies and how to apply cyber security. Strong understanding of exploits, vulnerabilities, attacks, and countermeasures. Assist in composing cyber security related communications for a wide audience. Advising and coaching first and second level incident responders. Responsible in assisting on metrics creation, reporting and presentation to senior leadership for incident response activities. Act as subject matter expert for cyber security events and or incidents. Ensure cyber security event SLA's are met across the team Ability to provide qualitative audits for previous cyber events for internal improvement Required Knowledge / Experience / Qualities Schooling Requirement-- High school equivalency or GED Years of experience -- 1+ year in enterprise security 2+ years in a technology role Certifications -- Good to have, not a requirement Knowledge of network ports, protocols, and associated cyber security defense measures. Understanding of web application security is a plus. Strong written and oral communication skills. Personality traits like critical thinking, strong team player, self-starter, eagerness to learn. Ability to adjust and work in a very fast-paced environment. We are currently seeking a talented UI Developer -- Mid Level for our Dallas, TX HQ. Copart UI Developers create and maintain the front-end portion of our business software applications. Done well, many may never realize or appreciate how critical these systems are or how we've made them simpler, faster, and safer. Yet, they help make our members' experience better. It's a great challenge and responsibility. As a UI Developer, you are expected to be able to function in a fast-paced environment driving innovation through rapid prototyping and iterative development ensuring quality is built into all solutions. Your responsibilities will require you to be familiar with front-end development best practices and frameworks, creating beautiful experiences for our internal and member-facing systems. You will be required to be knowledgeable in understanding user requirements and tailoring user experiences accordingly. You will engage with business clients, UX designers, developers, and architects to create high-performing and easy-to-use systems via web-based applications. You will create and implement design principles that ensure that our content renders well across multiple devices. You will use and promote the use of front-end and mobile testing tools to ensure quality. As a UI Developer, it will be your responsibility to maintain code integrity and quality Primary Responsibilities ‚ñ™ Create Web application front end as per design comps and information architecture ‚ñ™ Build large-scale modern web applications ‚ñ™ Follow best practices and standards for accessibility and cross-browser compatibility ‚ñ™ Dive into the source code of front-end libraries to debug, patch, and extend them when necessary. ‚ñ™ Stick to established coding standards and group procedures individually and in teams ‚ñ™ Add to the engineering team's culture of high code quality ‚ñ™ Coordinate with Interface Design Architects for meeting accessibility standards at code level ‚ñ™ Create conceptual diagrams, visual mock-ups, and manage detailed user interface specifications Minimum Requirements ‚ñ™ Master's Degree in Computer Science or relevant technical discipline (or equivalent experience) Must be Very proficient with HTML5 and CSS ‚ñ™ 4+ years of software development experience in JavaScript, CSS, and HTML with experience with JavaScript Frameworks Most Importantly React JS and React Native ‚ñ™ Skilled in developing rich applications with HTML, CSS, JS & Jquery

The Senior Internal Auditor will facilitate the SOX Annual Cycle including owning the documentation refresh process and preparing business partners for control walkthroughs. Other responsibilities include planning and performing SOX testing of key controls, with the expectation of presenting testing results to management as well as oversight of staff internal auditors. In the event of a control failure, the Senior Internal Auditor will support remediation efforts to closure. This position acts as an advisor to his / her respective business partners to drive continuous process improvement. In addition to SOX, the Senior Internal Auditor will assist with other special projects that arise as a result of the Company's fast-paced and constantly evolving environment. Responsibilities Plan, document, and execute testing of SOX controls with consistent quality Take ownership of all assigned process areas, which includes obtaining a comprehensive understanding of all process activities and controls as well as related company policies and external accounting and reporting guidelines Work with business process owners to gain an understanding of the process, associated risks, and key controls to be tested Collaborate with business process owners and offer recommendations in designing new processes and controls or updating current ones Assess and make recommendations/suggestions regarding the efficiency and effectiveness of processes and operations Be aware of current developments in processes, internal policies and procedures, and external accounting and reporting guidance, and critically challenge the purpose of procedures. Drive consistency in approach to recommend, where appropriate, adaptation to our audit methodology to ensure continuous improvement Build strong, working relationships with internal departments, including those in international locations, IT personnel, and external auditors Remain current on SEC, US GAAP, and other regulatory and technical guidance and regulations as it pertains to SOX and other related activities and performs applicable testing in line with standards for technically complex areas (i.e. Revenue Recognition, Purchase Accounting, etc.) Lead and/or contribute to special projects, as needed, in an effective and efficient manner Proactively anticipate customer needs/opportunities for involvement (i.e. think ahead of the curve and creatively) Required Skills And Experience Bachelor's degree in Accounting or equivalent 2+ years of experience in public accounting auditing publicly traded companies or industry equivalent (preferred) CPA/CIA certification or candidate (preferred) Solid understanding of financial audit and financial and operational internal control methodologies and terminology (e.g. COSO), as well as the Sarbanes Oxley Act of 2002 and Audit Standard 5 Technical knowledge of financial accounting and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (U.S. GAAP), and understanding of and ability to research and apply the guidance to changing control environment Specialist in Microsoft Office Suite, Visio, and Lucidchart Excellent written and verbal communication skills Confidence/willingness to ask questions and raise issues/concerns in a timely manner Strong attention to detail Sound professional judgment and discernment Ability to travel may be required, up to 5% For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Copart is seeking a SRE Engineer for our Dallas HQ office specializing in Systems and application monitoring and troubleshooting. This position will be part of a 24/7 Global Network Operations team that monitors and provides L1/L2 support to meet the SLA commitment of Copart's Global Data Center and Application infrastructure. Ideal Candidate Team Player -- Candidate that works well in a collaborate team environment. Effective communication skills and a great personality is a must. Talented -- Your skillsets expand beyond the core knowledge of Windows, UNIX, or Linux platforms. Not only should you be knowledgeable in core Systems, experience in VM environment, Networking, Scripting, Automation, Kubernetes, and awareness of other technologies is a plus. Innovative -- We are always looking for ways improve our process and procedures. The ideal candidate should have natural desire to make things better and not be afraid to speak up if an opportunity for improvement arises. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Perform application deployments using Jenkins and Spinnaker on Prod and Non-Prod Environments. Coordinate and Perform periodic failover testing of Copart's Network/Systems Infrastructure and application environments. Build/Optimize tools with Python, Ansible and Grafana to monitor/collect key metrics and automate remediation of Infrastructure or application issues. Maintenance and Optimization of the following tools and repositories (Nagios, Netbox, Prometheus, Grafana, Sumologic, Selenium, Instana, Github and more...) Interface with internal teams (Product development, DevOps, Network, Systems and DB) Utilize internal monitoring tools to analyze and pro-actively monitor Copart's Global Data Center and Application infrastructure to catch and quickly resolve issues before it arises. Document standard operating procedures, diagrams, and training materials for use by the teams. Troubleshooting knowledge with Linux/Unix/Windows based systems Working with VM management software - Vsphere Knowledge of monitoring tools, Nagios, Solar Winds, Site24*7 Be flexible and be able to handle competing/changing priorities. Very strong oral and written communication skills Must be a self-starter with the ability to work well in a team environment Flexible schedule required Knowledge of the areas are a BIG plus Dashboard applications such as Grafana Scripting/Programing/Automation -- Python, Bash, Ansible, Stackstorm Experience working with Github, Jenkins, Spinnaker, Docker, Kubernetes Front end scripting languages, libraries and frameworks such as Java, Javascript, Angular JS, Flask et For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Copart is seeking a Sr. Network Engineer in the Dallas area. This position will be part of a network engineering team that manages the domestic and global network operations of Copart. In this role, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining Copart's Domestic and Global Data Center and remote office networks. This is a hybrid work-from-home position that will be officing out of the Addison, TX headquarters. Ideal Candidate Team Player -- First and foremost, we are looking for a candidate that works well in a team environment. Effective communication skills and the ability to support others are a must. Results-Oriented -- You must be able to deliver projects on time and meet commitments. Talented -- Your skillsets expand beyond the core disciplines of a network engineer. Not only should you be knowledgeable in Routing, Switching, and firewalls, you should also be competent in other technologies such as Scripting, Automation, and System services and applications. Innovative -- We are always looking for ways to improve our processes and procedures. The ideal candidate should have a natural desire to make things better and not be afraid to speak up if an opportunity for improvement arises. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Continually work towards building trust and relationships with team members. Provide operational support to international and domestic networks Troubleshoot ISP circuit issues Participate in the on-call rotation Lead and complete projects (big or small) that may span across departments Consistently analyze application and bandwidth requirements and provide recommendations to meet needs. Research, evaluate and recommend tools can provide visibility to the health of the network. Introduce/improve processes and procedures to respond to problems. Consistently monitor network health conditions and pro-actively take action to avoid issue escalation. Improve and introduce best practice procedures, standards, and policies. Deploy, scale, and automate our network across multiple global offices/datacenters in new and existing locations. Create and update network standards and ensure that the network is deployed to those standards Document standard operating procedures, diagrams, and training materials for use by the teams Support a WAN environment consisting of SD-WAN and Site-to-Site VPN technologies Work closely with our internal customers to help alleviate their problems and ensure the network team continues to meet their demands. Review and implement changes on the network, following change management process (ITIL) Serves as a key resource for infrastructure and application problem determination and resolution Utilize internal monitoring tools to pro-actively optimize network infrastructure and/or catch and fix issues before it arises. Must be a self-starter with the ability to work well in a team environment Solid oral and written communication skills Must have the ability to practice sound judgment in complex, high-pressure situations Active Cisco Certifications: CCNA, CCNP, and/or CCIE (Plus) Must have solid engineering and operational experience in zero-downtime e-commerce type infrastructure. The ability to gather requirements and perform circuit turn-ups with ISPs Flexibility to remediate network device vulnerabilities promptly. Extensive experience configuring, deploying, and troubleshooting Cisco platforms and technologies, including but not limited to the following: Catalyst series switches 6500, 9300, 9200, 4500, 3700, 3800 Rugged and Industrial Switches Nexus series switches 9K, 7K, 5K FortiGate Firewalls ASA firewalls 5500, 5500-x Series Indoor/Outdoor Meraki, Mist, FortiGate Aps Ubiquity Bridges VRF, ASA Context, and VDC Catalyst Stacking, VSS, ASA -- Clustering, ASA Active/Standby OSPF, BGP, EIGRP, STP AnyConnect VPN, FortiClient, Site to Site VPN's, GRE/IPSEC VPN Authentication Protocols -- AAA, RADIUS, TACACS, ISE Azure, AWS Cloud Connectivity A10 Load balancers configuration/implementation SolarWinds, PRTG, Nagios Design/implementation experience with SDWAN technologies Layer-1 Cabling and Modules (Copper, Fiber, SFPs) Cradle Point LTE/4G/5G Technologies Proven competency and knowledge in the following areas are a BIG plus. Scripting/Programing/Automation-- Perl, Python, PHP CLI, Ansible HP, Cisco, Supermicro Storage Switches Battery Backup Systems (APC, Cyberpower, Tripp Lite) Working knowledge using linux/unix based systems Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

The Staff Internal Auditor will assist in facilitating the SOX Annual Cycle including owning the documentation refresh process and preparing business partners for control walkthroughs. Other responsibilities include planning and performing SOX testing of key controls, with the expectation of presenting testing results to management. In the event of a control failure, the Staff Internal Auditor will support remediation efforts to closure. This position acts as an advisor to his / her respective business partners to drive continuous process improvement. In addition to SOX, the Staff Internal Auditor will assist with other special projects that arise as a result of the Company's fast-paced and constantly evolving environment. Examples of these other special projects include system implementations, segregation of duties, and business process standardization. Job Duties Plan, document, and execute testing of SOX controls with consistent quality Take ownership for all assigned process areas, which includes obtaining a comprehensive understanding of all process activities and controls as well as related company policies and external accounting and reporting guidelines Work with business process owners to gain an understanding of the process, associated risks, and key controls to be tested Collaborate with business process owners and offer recommendations in designing new processes and controls or updating current ones Assess and make recommendations/suggestions regarding the efficiency and effectiveness of processes and operations Be aware of current developments in processes, internal policies and procedures, and external accounting and reporting guidance and critically challenge the purpose of procedures. Drive consistency in approach to recommend, where appropriate, adaptation to our audit methodology to ensure continuous improvement Build strong, working relationships with internal departments, including those in international locations, IT personnel, and external auditors Remain current on SEC, US GAAP, and other regulatory and technical guidance and regulations as it pertains to SOX and other related activities and perform applicable testing in line with standards for technically complex areas (i.e. Revenue Recognition, Purchase Accounting, etc.) Lead and/or contribute to special projects, as needed, in an effective and efficient manner Proactively anticipate customer needs/opportunities for involvement (i.e. think ahead of the curve and creatively) Required Skills And Experience Bachelor's degree in Accounting or equivalent 1+ years of experience in public accounting auditing publicly traded companies and/or industry equivalent (preferred) CPA/CIA/CISA certification or candidate (preferred) Solid understanding of financial audit and financial and operational internal control methodologies and terminology (e.g. COSO), as well as the Sarbanes Oxley Act of 2002 and Audit Standard 5 Technical knowledge of financial accounting and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (U.S. GAAP), and understanding of and ability to research and apply guidance to changing control environment Specialist in Microsoft Office Suite, Visio and Lucidchart Excellent written and verbal communication skills Confidence/willingness to ask questions and raise issues/concerns in a timely manner Strong attention to detail Sound professional judgment and discernment Ability to travel may be required, up to 5% Minimum starting range: $55,000 For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Copart is a looking for a Systems Engineer to support, troubleshoot, automate and maintain the IT Infrastructure of internal and external customer environments. This includes Windows server administration, Linux server administration, Enterprise storage management, virtualization, performance tuning, backup/restore and Automation of operational duties. The Systems Engineer will research and resolve technical problems under the supervision of the Systems Engineering Manager. This position will also help develop/improve Systems Engineering documentation. Seeking team players with excellent communication skills and can manage assignments independently. The ideal candidate will have a nurturing personality and the desire to help in the development and mentoring of others. In this role, you will support multiple Data Centers as well as the cloud infrastructure, specifically AWS. Candidates must have a Systems Administration background with 3+ years of experience and have worked in an agile, project-orientated, enterprise environment. Job duties include, but are not limited to, the following: Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation as it relates to server and network topology, equipment, best practices, and configuration(s). Develop and Follow project plans, design, and implement solutions. Engineer applications to automate operational tasks to automate the Systems Infrastructure. Standard system administration duties including server install, System/Application installs and patch management, problem determination and resolution, log analysis, etc. Assist with providing Infrastructure services in all areas needed: storage networking, operating system management, network security, directory services, server virtualization, using system backup and restore, system and system monitoring, application installation and configuration. Assist and generates with weekly reports. Utilize superior customer service skills at all times. Stay current with system information, changes, and updates. Ready to participate in 24x7 on-call rotations. Maintain configuration management for multiple environments. Provide root cause analysis and corrective actions for issues. Desired Skills Ability to work under pressure, solve complex technical problems quickly (minutes or hours), automate processes and solutions using available tools and develop in-house tools where necessary. Demonstrated proficiency of Red Hat Linux and CentOS Linux distributions. Understanding of TCP/IP and other networking and data communication technologies such as HTTP/HTTPS, DNS, SMTP, SSH, TCP, NAT along with basic knowledge of distributed computing environments. Solid proficiency in one or more of the UNIX shells, Python, PERL, Javascript. Hands-on experience with VMware Esxi 6/7. Understanding Load Balancing as well as experience with one or more web servers such as Apache HTTPD or Nginx. Understanding of Object Storage platforms such as Amazon S3, Scality or Swiftstack. Configuration management tools such as Ansible, Saltstack, Puppet or Chef. Experience with log management tools like Elasticsearch, Splunk, Graylog or any others. Basic experience with Kubernetes or any container technologies. Understanding and ability to diagnose and troubleshoot enterprise class servers as well as Storage(SAN). Working knowledge of CI/CD and Git. Front-end development skills in addition to the above skills are highly desired. Strong documentation skills. Required Experience Bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer science or related field 3+ years experience working in a Linux environment. 3+ years experience with Systems or hardware administration 3+ years experience with any configuration management tool (Ansible, Puppet, Salt, Chef) 2+ years experience with one of the following scripting languages: Python, Javascript or Go. 2+ years experience with VMware administration Experience with the following protocols: SSH, NFS, HTTP(S), DNS, SMTP. For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. This is not a support or administrative role - strictly projects with a 20% Project Management, 80% Hands-on technical skill set requirement. You are expected to lead your own projects to completion and report on progress or blockers daily. Projects can be team-based or also individual based. We are looking for highly motivated people with a hunger to learn. A successful candidate will be disciplined in their craft, methodical, and able to drive projects to completion) Candidates will have a "Hands-On" IT Engineering background (Systems, communications, mobility, connectivity, networking, management platforms) as well as solid networking skills to lead and manage large-scale technical projects. You must also be a thought leader, driven with an ambition to innovate and truly be an engineer. This role will Research, Engineer, Test, Communicate, & Deploy the solutions. Then train the Level 1 and Level 2 teams to support. Will provide leadership in the thought of new ideas, the design, the development, and the execution. You must be hands-on -- and type the commands, create and run the scripts when needed - always with a focus on automation and increasing efficiencies. This team is responsible for the current solutions used out in the field but will be paving the way with our next generations IT deployments in the following areas: Mobile Device Management (AirWatch, Android, Phones and Tablets) Wi-Fi Service & Wireless Connectivity (Services) Workspace/Backoffice systems (Thin Clients, Windows IoT, Google Chromebook, Virtual Desktops) Self Service IVR w Artificial Intelligence (Telephony, Call Centers) Technology that lives in the field The ideal candidate has an engineering specialization in one or more of the above but has adminstrative experience or deep interest in the others Working cross-functionally with stakeholders such as Copart IT & Copart Operations, to build and integrate the next wave of technical solutions to increase operational efficiency, lower cost, and shorten lead times. Responsibilities Develop and maintain a strong professional relationship with our internal customer Lead large technical projects, from inception to hands-on implementation You will strategize, plan, test and manage the deployments of solutions in the organization Responsible for the rate of adoption of new technologies Staying on top of the latest technology that can complement our business Networking Strong IP Telephony & Networking experience in deploying, managing and services such as: Strong Mobile, MDM, BYOD -- AirWatch Enterprise Mobility Manager Solution, Certified preferred SIP Protocol, IVR, Asterisk, VoIP, QoS, and other communication stacks Solid understanding of Cisco Routers, Firewalls, Switches, VLANs, & Meraki AP Configuration Understanding of Azure AD, Single Sign On, Multi Factor Authentication Systems/ Mobile Desktops (Dell and Lenovo) Imaging Solutions, Apple & Dell Laptops, Mobile Devices Programming / Automation Bonus points for PowerShell, VBScript, XML, and Complex Excel Formulas, Automation on any platform Interpersonal Strong communication, Presentation, and solid project management skills Clear Communication, Presentation skills & Time management Ability to drive projects autonomously, as well as take input from others to optimize strategy and project flow Creativity Ingenuity, Innovation skills, and abilities are a must Leadership Creative Thought Leader Be a very Fast Learner -- Quickly absorb new information Teach, Learn, & Inspire Coordinate and monitor team progress Required Experience: At least 7 years of relevant recent IT Hands on experience 2 Years of experience in implementing / deploying IT solutions and some Project Management Skills Experience delivering business tools and systems in a cross-functional environment Experience in a multi-location (Global) Fas

The Title Specialist will be responsible for the daily processing of vehicle titles. Through a thorough understanding of corresponding state and local title processing regulations and Copart policies, the Title Specialist will answer questions; provide support and facilitate the Copart experience through offering solutions to meet customers' needs. In addition, the Title Specialist will maintain file documentation, update customers on file status, and maintain accurate records of vehicle titling within company guidelines. The Title Specialist will be the face of the company through face-to-face and vocal interactions with all levels of customers which range from the general public to high-level managers of organizations. Efficiently and accurately identify/analyze vehicle title/ownership documents within company guidelines. Provide excellent customer service to all internal and external customers. Process vehicle titles in accordance with state guidelines. Research missing and/or incorrect title paperwork and determine proper resolve in a timely manner. Communicate with customers via email or verbally to handle title issues daily. Build relationships and develop a professional rapport with DMV and sellers. Maintain title bin filing as necessary. Performs other duties as assigned. HS diploma. Two years customer service experience. One year vehicle title processing. Computer proficiency (MS Office Word / Suite). Typing speed 45 words per minute. Basic 10 Key proficiency. Excellent customer service skills and attitude. Excellent communication skills - verbal and written. Must be able to work under pressure and meet time sensitive deadlines. Must be able to multi-task. Must be able to work independently with little supervision. Must be able to view a computer screen for a significant portion of the work day. Strong attention to detail. Title knowledge of local and surrounding states is preferred. Strong organizational skills. Numeric and alphabetic filing skills are mandatory. Must be able to work overtime schedule as needed. Notary license preferred. Bilingual a plus. Occasional overtime as needed. For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

The Part Time Title Express Processor is responsible for assisting auto insurance companies with procurement of vehicle titles, title paperwork, and working with financial institutions and vehicle owners. Opening/scanning mail received Call queue (ability to answer basic TP questions, give claim updates and direct caller to correct party/team if applicable Total Loss Packets (create and send all documents required per state guidelines) Initial Lien Holder calls (Calls are to secure payoff information, Letters of Guarantee and Copy of Title) Initial calls to owners/insureds (these are customer specific tasks and it used to inform owner of packet that will be sent to them) Follow-up calls to owners/insureds to follow-up on needed documents or corrected documents needed Follow-up calls to Lien Holders (for documents listed above in the initial call) Will send out revised packets to the owners/insureds as needed Will be held to the internal cycle times and other auditable criteria Mail Approvals -Reviewing all mail to ensure that documents are compliant per State guidelines Launch the "Okay to Pay" the owner/insured to the Insurance company after final review of file for compliance Will monitor and work a shared inbox to ensure the tasks and directives are addressed and completed per company policy, timelines and contractual obligation. Other tasks as assigned by management 2 plus years of office customer service experience Education: HS degree Proficient in basic office equipment and with Microsoft products Ability to identify/analyze vehicle title documents within company and State guidelines Ability to work closely with State DMV's and Lien Holder entities Problem solver Ability to multi-task Basic 10 key proficiency Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Excellent communication skills -- written and verbal Excellent customer service skills and attitude Basic math skills Ability to delegate/prioritize work flow Ability to work independently or in a team environment Ability to read/write in English fluently and effectively Valid driver's license Occasional overtime as needed For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. The Title Specialist will be the face of the company through face-to-face and vocal interactions with all levels of customers which range from the general public to high-level managers of organizations. Efficiently and accurately identify/analyze vehicle title/ownership documents within company guidelines. Provide excellent customer service to all internal and external customers. Process vehicle titles in accordance with state guidelines. Research missing and/or incorrect title paperwork and determine proper resolve in a timely manner. Communicate with customers via email or verbally to handle title issues daily. Build relationships and develop a professional rapport with DMV and sellers. Maintain title bin filing as necessary. Performs other duties as assigned. HS diploma. Two years customer service experience. One year vehicle title processing. Computer proficiency (MS Office Word / Suite). Typing speed 45 words per minute. Basic 10 Key proficiency. Excellent customer service skills and attitude. Excellent communication skills - verbal and written. Must be able to work under pressure and meet time sensitive deadlines. Must be able to multi-task. Must be able to work independently with little supervision. Must be able to view a computer screen for a significant portion of the work day. Strong attention to detail. Title knowledge of local and surrounding states is preferred. Strong organizational skills. Numeric and alphabetic filing skills are mandatory. Must be able to work overtime schedule as needed. Notary license preferred. Bilingual a plus. Occasional overtime as needed. For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Copart is now hiring Class C tow truck drivers, across the nation, for their newly delivered fleet of two-car rollbacks. These trucks, when not supporting your local Copart facility, will be deployed to various locations across the country to assist in Catastrophe Response (hurricane, hail, flooding). Are you looking for competitive pay in the towing industry? Hard work pays off. You could easily earn a 6 figure salary with our commission-based pay. While deployed, drivers will support increased volume and increased commission pay. Do you enjoy traveling? Copart arranges and pays all travel expenses, including $45/day per diem and doubled piece rates while deployed. Do you enjoy working with the latest technology? Copart has a state-of-the-art towing app and dispatch technology for the most efficient runs. Are you looking for a company that appreciates you and rewards you for your hard work? Copart started in 1982 and has been an industry leader in innovation and service, is part of the S&P 500, has an incredible culture with talented and diverse employees, and is ready for you to start a career with endless opportunities. What do we want you to bring to the table? We are looking for professional, hardworking, focused, team players that are willing to bring their best. Minimum of 1 year towing and/or securement experience, Class C driver's license -- we will teach you everything else you need to know to be successful. What we will bring to the table? We have everything you need to get started - Newly delivered 2-car rollbacks (4-car also available), insurance, training, and advancement opportunities. Copart offers health insurance (vision, dental available), life insurance, 401k match, employee assistance program, flexible spending account, paid time off, and our employee stock purchase program! Responsibilities And Duties Must be willing to travel nationally on short notice $45 Daily Per Diem paid while traveling Weekly Bonus while traveling Must possess at least a valid Class C Driver's License issued by your state of residence Local pick-up and delivery of vehicles to designated Copart facility Load/unload vehicles safely and free of damage Operate company equipment in compliance with safety regulations Deploy to catastrophe events within 24 hours when directed to do so Maintain and assure good operating condition of all equipment and facilities Other tasks as assigned by the manager in support of daily auctions Required Skills & Experience Open to applicants 21+ years old Must possess at least a valid Class C Driver's License issued by your state of residence Ability to travel by plane Minimum of 1-year towing and/or load securement experience in the last 5 years preferred Must meet background screening criteria Military applicants are strongly encouraged to apply Completive commission-based pay Must be able to work long hours 12-14 hours per day. Be able to travel with 24 hours or less notice. Ability to work in extreme conditions weather and terrain. Benefits 401(k) Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Referral program Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Starting Pay Range $21.05 to $23.71/Hr For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family - it's like coming home. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

What do we want you to bring to the table? We are looking for professional, hardworking, focused, team players that are willing to bring their best. Minimum of 1 year towing and/or securement experience, Class C driver's license -- we will teach you everything else you need to know to be successful. What we will bring to the table? We have everything you need to get started - Newly delivered 2-car rollbacks (4-car also available), insurance, training, and advancement opportunities. Copart offers health insurance (vision, dental available), life insurance, 401k match, employee assistance program, flexible spending account, paid time off, and our employee stock purchase program! Responsibilities And Duties Must be willing to travel nationally on short notice $45 Daily Per Diem paid while traveling Weekly Bonus while traveling Must possess at least a valid Class C Driver's License issued by your state of residence Local pick-up and delivery of vehicles to designated Copart facility Load/unload vehicles safely and free of damage Operate company equipment in compliance with safety regulations Deploy to catastrophe events within 24 hours when directed to do so Maintain and assure good operating condition of all equipment and facilities Other tasks as assigned by the manager in support of daily auctions Required Skills & Experience Open to applicants 21+ years old Must possess at least a valid Class C Driver's License issued by your state of residence Ability to travel by plane Minimum of 1-year towing and/or load securement experience in the last 5 years preferred Must meet background screening criteria Military applicants are strongly encouraged to apply Completive commission-based pay Must be able to work long hours 12-14 hours per day. Be able to travel with 24 hours or less notice. Ability to work in extreme conditions weather and terrain. Benefits 401(k) Dental insurance Employee assistance program Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Referral program Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family - it's like coming home. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Be able to travel with 24 hours or less notice. Ability to work in extreme conditions weather and terrain. Have you ever dreamed of owning your own successful towing business, working flexible hours, working with the latest technology, and being your own boss. Not having funding or experience holding you back? Copart Transportation Service Providers can help. No Experience? No Problem. We will teach you everything you need to know to be successful. No special licensing required to operate a 2 car rollback tow truck. You will go through Copart's paid towing training program for 120 days to teach you everything you need to know about the industry. Once you graduate from this paid program, we will finance for you a new tow truck, we will guarantee daily work, we will teach you how to run your own business and assist you in getting additional contracts. We are looking for highly motivated individuals who want to run their own business. We will get you the truck, funding, and training. And we will teach you how to run a small business. No experience necessary. Enroll in Copart's paid towing training program and graduate with your own business! Do you enjoy working with the latest technology? Copart has a state-of-the-art towing app and dispatch technology for the most efficient runs. Copart started in 1982 and has been an industry leader in innovation and service, is part of the S&P 500, has an incredible culture with talented and diverse employees. We are ready to get you started today as one of our business partners as the owner of your own towing business. Apply to become a successful business owner today. We are currently seeking talented UI Developer -- Mid Level for our Dallas, TX HQ. Copart UI Developers create and maintain the front-end portion of our business software applications. Done well, many may never realize or appreciate how critical these systems are or how we've made them simpler, faster, and safer. Yet, they help make our members' experience better. It's a great challenge and responsibility. As a UI Developer, you are expected to be able to function in a fast-paced environment driving innovation through rapid prototyping and iterative development ensuring quality is built into all solutions. Your responsibilities will require you to be familiar in front end development best practices and frameworks, creating beautiful experiences for our internal and member facing systems. You will be required to be knowledgeable in understanding user requirements and tailoring user experiences accordingly. You will engage with business clients, UX designers, developers and architects to create high performing and easy to use systems via the web-based applications. You will create and implement design principles that ensures that our content renders well across multiple devices. You will use and promote the use of front-end and mobile testing tools to ensure quality. As a UI Developer, it will be your responsibility to maintain code integrity and quality Primary Responsibilities ‚ñ™ Create Web application front end as per design comps and information architecture ‚ñ™ Build large-scale modern web applications ‚ñ™ Follow best practices and standards for accessibility and cross-browser compatibility ‚ñ™ Dive into the source code of front-end libraries to debug, patch, and extend them when necessary ‚ñ™ Stick to established coding standards and group procedures individually and in teams ‚ñ™ Add to engineering team's culture of high code quality ‚ñ™ Coordinate with Interface Design Architects for meeting accessibility standards at code level ‚ñ™ Create conceptual diagrams, visual mock-ups, and manage detailed user interface specifications Minimum Requirements ‚ñ™ Master's Degree in Computer Science or relevant technical discipline (or equivalent experience) Must be Very proficient with HTML5 and CSS ‚ñ™ 4+ years of software development experience in JavaScript, CSS and HTML with experience with JavaScript Frameworks Most Importantly React JS and React Native ‚ñ™ Skilled in developing rich applications with HTML, CSS, JS & Jquery For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. We are currently seeking talented UI Developer -- Mid-Level for our Dallas, TX HQ. Copart UI Developers create and maintain the front-end portion of our business software applications. Done well, many may never realize or appreciate how critical these systems are or how we've made them simpler, faster, and safer. Yet, they help make our members' experience better. It's a great challenge and responsibility. As a UI Developer, you are expected to be able to function in a fast-paced environment driving innovation through rapid prototyping and iterative development ensuring quality is built into all solutions. Your responsibilities will require you to be familiar in front end development best practices and frameworks, creating beautiful experiences for our internal and member facing systems. You will be required to be knowledgeable in understanding user requirements and tailoring user experiences accordingly. You will engage with business clients, UX designers, developers and architects to create high performing and easy to use systems via the web-based applications. You will create and implement design principles that ensures that our content renders well across multiple devices. You will use and promote the use of front-end and mobile testing tools to ensure quality. As a UI Developer, it will be your responsibility to maintain code integrity and quality Primary Responsibilities ‚ñ™ Create Web application front end as per design comps and information architecture ‚ñ™ Build large-scale modern web applications ‚ñ™ Follow best practices and standards for accessibility and cross-browser compatibility ‚ñ™ Dive into the source code of front-end libraries to debug, patch, and extend them when necessary ‚ñ™ Stick to established coding standards and group procedures individually and in teams ‚ñ™ Add to engineering team's culture of high code quality ‚ñ™ Coordinate with Interface Design Architects for meeting accessibility standards at code level ‚ñ™ Create conceptual diagrams, visual mock-ups, and manage detailed user interface specifications Minimum Requirements ‚ñ™ Master's Degree in Computer Science or relevant technical discipline (or equivalent experience) ‚ñ™ Must be Very proficient with HTML5 and CSS ‚ñ™ 4+ years of software development experience in JavaScript, CSS and HTML with experience with JavaScript Frameworks Most Importantly React JS and React Native ‚ñ™ Skilled in developing rich applications with HTML, CSS, JS & Jquery For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family--it's like coming home. A vehicle purchasing agent is responsible for handling all requests of customers looking to sell their vehicles. On a daily basis agents are responsible for handling inbound calls, making offers on vehicles and close as many sales as you can. You will be handling calls from customers who will want to sell Junk & Auction vehicles. An agent is required to take 50-100 calls per day. Software currently being used is Microsoft Access, Salesforce & five9. All simple data entry with training. You will have veterans who have been in the business for years that can give you hands on training. You are required to meet certain quotas. Job Requirements Ability to analyze and learn Copart sale values/trends Ability to work independently in a fast paced performance based environment. Gather information via phone and computer, research comparable vehicle sales history, and work toward making accurate, financially sound automotive purchasing decisions Ability to track and retain trends in the retail/wholesale market - apply to purchasing decisions Ability to initiate sales calls and close a high number of sales. Ability to document activity using various software tools Required Skills And Experience Customer service focused MS Office (Excel & Word) Excellent organizational skills Ability to speak clearly Bilingual skills are a plus Knowledge of the automotive industry a plus Starting Pay Range $15/Hr Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Participates in demos, code reviews, and retrospectives; communicates ideas for team continuous improvement and willingly receives feedback for self-improvement Focuses on delivering business priority and value at all times Participate in QA testing activities, including testing at the task and end-to-end process levels, integration testing, and user acceptance testing. Document technical designs, release notes, and other project documentation in Confluence to support development, security, operations, and maintenance. Complete Daily/Weekly/Monthly Audits Daily Scheduling with Employee Time and Attendance Assist is security/loss prevention Monitor Productivity Monitor and maintain clean work environment Enforce safety awareness Oversee loading of vehicles Handle Employee/Customer Service Issues Maintain supply inventory and purchase supplies Enforce company policy and procedure Ability to complete all job tasks for positions supervised Travel as needed Maintain confidential information/documentation Ability to work on mechanical issues present on lots Fleet Management and preventive maintenance Monitor and maintain yard fence Facility and yard maintenance Available to answer alarm calls as needed 1 plus years of supervisory or equivalent experience High School Diploma, some college or more preferred Basic knowledge of automotive mechanics Excellent customer service skills and attitude Computer proficiency ( MS Suite experience) Ability to work in a fast paced environment Ability to direct and train others effectively as a team member Excellent communication skills written and verbal skills Ability to delegate/prioritize skills Ability to work independently or in a team environment Ability to read/write in English fluently Ability to coach, mentor, train staff Ability to differentiate color Possess excellent customer service skills Inventory management skills Bilingual skills a plus Valid driver's license Occasional overtime Pay starting at $24.60 an hour For nearly four decades, Copart has led its industry in innovation and customer service, enabling it to grow profitably in markets across the globe. Our success is the direct result of the skills and efforts of our talented and diverse employees. Our mindset? It's never just a "job" when your coworkers are like family - it's like coming home.
